description.value:
With yourself as your favorite test subject, you focus on the mutagenic interactions between the metabolic quintessences, crafting transformations that sometimes sacrifice one aspect of a creature's being in order to strengthen another.

Your reservoir's core trait can be considered either polymorph or morph as desired, but not both simultaneously. As you increase your Alchemist level, add the below discoveries to your Formula Book. Additionally, you gain Living Weapon.

Living Weapon

As a Mutagenist, there is a higher likelihood of you making unarmed Strikes. You have learned how to affix all talismans with Alchemist’s Tools. Even if you must resort to applying alchemical glue to your skin, you can affix talismans directly to your strange body. For the purpose of affixing a talisman, each listed unarmed attack you have is considered as a valid melee weapon. You may affix a talisman to an unarmed attack you do not yet have (due to a lacking mutation or other reason), but cannot use the talisman without the declared unarmed attack.

Level 1 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.JwsE6ERIlq72X189]{Disorienting Squirt}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.VHpWLCJ4MOcTvdAn]{Adrenal Sensitivity}

Level 3 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.l6nteFKC7pfHG33w]{Syringe Hooks}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.yAqipSRQUvjOP1jn]{Suppressive Resonance}

Level 5 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Item.yC3ZrMCNzGH0qrHu]{Exsanguinating Carcinogen}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.0cmTO7i8Lnm74nKv]{Morphic Incubation}

Level 7 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.NmWIlE1HhjDXcmHT]{Personal Naturalization}

There’s no sight more beautiful to you than a strange brew bubbling in a beaker, and you eagerly consumeyour ingenious elixirs to accrue more data. In your pursuit to go beyond the mundane chemistry of thematerial realm, your understanding of quintessence gives you access to a sliver of creation. As a properAlchemist, you leverage dominion over your own self to siphon your blank potential into a reservoir of mostly-stable quintessence. As an adventurer, you might fearlessly hurl explosives at your foes, or perhaps carefullycraft your infused reagents into potent medicines. Your unique path toward greatness is lined with alchemicaldiscoveries forged from the trials and tribulations you must overcome with each step.

Trigger you create an infused elixir with the morph or polymorph trait

This alchemical tweak enables your transformations to lie dormant until needed. When an item with this additive is Activated, its initial effect can be delayed for up to X hours, duration and effects only beginning when the target spends a 1 Action concentrate, or when the delay reaches its time limit. Dormant effects still count toward the typical single morph and polymorph limit.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

- 1 max HP per level

Another trait beyond that gained from your Research Field has begun to harmonize and resonate with your Reservoir of Quintessence. This additional trait enables a wider selection of items for Siphon Creation and increases Infused Alchemy batch output.

Select one of the following traits that you do not already posses, and add it to your reservoirs.

Healing, Bomb, Splash, Poison, Injury, Inhaled, Elixir, Lozenge, Mutagen, Polymorph, Morph, or a single energy damage type. You may also choose "Alchemical Ammunition", despite it not being a trait.

When you gain expertise in your class DC, add an additional option.
When you gain mastery in your class DC, add a third option.

Activate 1 minute

When you activate this item, you wrap and prepare a collar of sturdy cordage or other throwing leverage around any number of your personal mini-bombs that you wish to modify. 

Holding the Twirl Cordage grants the following Action.

Start Twirl 1 Manipulate

If you take damage from an external source while a twirl is ongoing, make a single DC 5 @Check[type:flat|dc:5] check as you start your next turn. On fail, all twirls are disrupted, but the bombs may be used normally. If you start a turn with a twirling bomb, you gain a +2 status bonus to an attack made with the bomb. You cannot twirl a bomb in exploration mode.

Even when you do not invoke the instant creation of your Infused Alchemy, you still find strange ways to improve and hasten along your production of alchemical items. Gain the skill feat @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.QLeMH5mQgh28sa5o]{Specialty Crafting} for Alchemy. Additionally, when you perform the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} activity to make alchemical items, you may utilize these eccentric methods for any number of the following benefits

  • Double the possible batch size, granting non-consumables a batch size of 2.
  • Multiply the rate of gp reduction from the finishing process by the number of items in the batch.
  • Only put down 20% of the gp cost when you start a Craft, instead of 50%. This enables you to work
    the finishing process to reduce the final cost down to 20% of the listed gp price.

If any of those benefits are used, the item becomes eccentric in form.

Such items are visibly odd or “dangerous” in their construction, and no one will purchase them. The items are slightly unstable, but safely so. They will become impotent and unusable 1 month after their creation. Impotent or not, you are able to recycle any eccentric item into any other eccentric Craft. When done, half their gp value is lost, and the other half contributes toward the setup cost.

Requirements A reservoir is full

Crudely dumping the reservoir into your hand, you command the quintessence to instantly manifest as any consumable alchemical item eligible for your @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Item.A2hGaTaUSakOwNJj]{Infused Reagents (Reformulated)} that also carries your reservoir’s trait. Without changing what items you may or may not create, the abnormal excess of quintessence increases your maximum item level by your class proficiency bonus (+2 for trained, +4 for expert, ect); this enables the use of Additives even when creating an item typically at the limit of your alchemical prowess.

The created item carries the infused trait, and as with all your infused items, any reference to saving throws in the item may be replaced with your Class DC.

Items created this way are unstable, and if unused by the end of the Alchemist’s next turn, dissolve into wisps of quintessence. For as long as the item or its effects persist, the reservoir it came from will not refill.

Special You can use this action as a free action gaining the flourish trait

With a little extra training, you are able to convert the many hours of hefting heavy fluids into an improved throw. For any attack or action that has a ranged thrown increment, gain half more of the base value. With a range increment of 20 ft, you now perform such throws at 30 ft before other considerations.

Whether you prefer a fast-acting dart from the shadows, or a close-range aerial dispersal, you specialize in all manner of alchemical debilitation. Your reservoir’s core trait is poison. As you increase your Alchemist level, add the below discoveries to your Formula Book. Additionally, you gain Weapon Vein.

Weapon Vein

As a Toxicologist, you may mount your reservoir upon a piercing or slashing weapon instead of your person. When done, you may not use Siphon Creation with a hand holding or wielding the weapon.

You may spend 1 additional Action during Siphon Creation to combine the creation of an injury poison with the application of it to the weapon attached to the reservoir. When affixed to any ranged weapon, this instead applies the poison to the next piece of ammunition.

If the attached weapon leaves the Toxicologist’s person for more than 1 minute, the reservoir will be empty upon recovery.

Level 1 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.JwsE6ERIlq72X189]{Disorienting Squirt}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.BfVAd2llhhsxll8Q]{Harmful Exposure}

Level 3 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.AEoAa4EMIJTpvEkJ]{Ready Reapplicator}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.bivXeoKCahU8X2Co]{Extra Affliction}

Level 5 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Hfs4lYBWycIWfJcV]{Black Blisters}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.IDWf6Q4jStNevFq1]{Aerosol}

Level 7 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.sBPDS8z5EzD6fUT8]{Transductive Cloud}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Vdrlv87klmfApKj6]{Hallucinogen}

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+1 max HP per level

This fusion between contradictory yet adjacent fields is able to transform alchemical harm into healing. While potent, it does strain the body uncomfortably. Once the effect ends, the target is immune to the benefits of the item for 1 hour.

Once Activated

  • Gain or increase resistance to poison damage by half your level.
  • Whenever you resist poison damage, heal for the amount resisted.
  • Take @Damage[4[persistent,poison]] damage. While the elixir is in effect, you can forgo attempting a check to end
    this damage.

If made Medicinal, the Additive instead increases the poison resistance provided by one third of X.

If made Harmful, the Additive instead increases the persistent damage by one third of X.

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5bRkIM49UEA4oX23]{Effect: Chemotherapeutic Curative Poison Resistance}

Special You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.ba3n8DWd45UQjyXf]{Toxic Treacle} ephemeral if you're a Chirurgeon, or the @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Dot24s9ZmbMY9Qwx]{Medicinal Boost} additive if you're a Toxicologist. You may only have a single Field Fusion feat at a time.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+1 status bonus to Will.

Trigger Your last action was Bottomless Creation, and the item’s base level is at least 6 lower than your Infused Alchemy level.

This wondrous Additive does not count toward the number of Additives an item may carry, but does contribute toward its total budget. Unlike normal Infused Alchemy, only items 6 levels lower than your level are eligible to be made Bottomless. Any effects created by this item will disappear after 1 minute has passed.

Requirements You have not used Flourish of Footwork since the beginning of your last turn
Trigger You use an action with the flourish trait

You’ve learned how vital your precise positioning can be, and have leveraged your expertise with multitasking to give yourself a new edge. You Step after the triggering action. 

If you are Master in your class DC, you may step either before or after the triggering action. If you are Legendary in your class DC, you may step both before and after.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+1 status penality to Will.

Trigger You create an infused item with the splash trait or an alchemical tool that creates hostile energies
over an area.

This simple enhancement to increase an expulsion's area can be hazardous without a Backfire Mantle. When the item is a bomb, the splash radius of a typical Strike is extended by 5ft. If the splash were to be limited to a single target, such as a bomb miss, it now splashes at 5ft. If nothing would be splashed, such as a critical miss, this Additive has no effect.

If using Additive 6, increase any listed splash damage by 2, and the splash is extended by 10ft. It still has no effect when no splash occurs.

For alchemical tools that create hostile energies: any cone, radius, or line is increased by the same 5 and 10 ft distances. If the item affects a single square, consider that to be a line of 5ft length, not a radius.

With careful study and rehearsal, you are able to utilize your intellect in the act of throwing weapons and adjusting your bomb splashes.

When you perform a throw-based action that involves your Dexterity modifier, you may use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier. 

If you are Striking with a bomb, you may instead use your intellect to remove the splash damage and effect, or to alter the normal splash damage into any number from 1 up to your Intelligence modifier.

Trigger A hostile action you are aware of begins, you have a comestible item in-hand.

Sacrificing defense, you quickly Interact to swallow the item before the incoming danger can land. This action does not trigger reactions. Become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} before the trigger is resolved, and remain off-guard until the start of your next turn.

You swallow the item before the blow lands, but the item’s effect occurs after the trigger is resolved, for example potentially allowing you to remain standing from a blow that would have knocked you unconscious (though you would still gain the dying and wounded conditions, potentially killing you outright). The triggering action cannot prevent the swallow nor effect. Both liquid comestibles such as elixirs and solid comestibles such as lozenges are eligible.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.3EGyVMirAAcyLGhu]{Chemotherapeutic Curative}

Gain or increase resistance to poison damage by half your level.

Note If you already have resistance through other methods increase it manually for the duration.

You are exceptional with the cerebral visualization and interpretation of alchemical creations, and have a knack for translating cursory knowledge and rumor into working formulae. Your gp cost of acquiring formulae is reduced to half.

Including at this level, whenever you gain formulas by increasing your Alchemist level, gain 1 additional common and 1 uncommon formula. Each time you increase your proficiency in Alchemy while you have this Feat, acquire a single rare formula; it may be higher than your level for delayed use. As always, the GM may veto the specific uncommon and rare selections.

This variable mass of homuncular flesh is custom made to reflect its desired function, and as part of the attachment process, both host and lump undergo a small mutagenic change indicative of the effects.

While not an elixir, this is a polymorphic mutagen, and is typically incompatible with other mutagens.

Upon creation, select one of the following alterations to take as a benefit. Once attached, roll on the table to discover the drawback. Exclude the chosen benefit from the possible drawbacks.

1

+- 5 ft status bonus to speeds

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.UGgRr8AkyDQwPDHH]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Bonus to Speed)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.rZwjxNx03uvoxs7x]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Penality to Speed)}
2-5

+- 1 status bonus to Fortitude, Will, Refex, or Armor Class respectively

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.ZUtPn6a3gpbBJLzw]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Bonus to Fortitude)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.3I8nR2UAXHfoJvX6]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Bonus to Will)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.BGzCy9KLbkdieFa0]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Bonus to Reflex)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.kDgZ1UgaXZSmVeSg]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Bonus to Armor Class)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.i7gn4XShcs7KdMDx]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Penality to Fortitude)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.3hTgZ0IKo1YhXzZG]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Penality to Will)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.uOBxgSzhwxlrhz7q]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Penality to Reflex)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.PNgg92LsbMOz48sp]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Penality to Armor Class)}
6

+- 1 max HP per level

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.3CwnKJjHWkOWcc8u]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Bonus to Health)}

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.0mZQzMtQwJHgQM01]{Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Penality to Health)}
7 Additional weakness or resistance to Poison Damage equal to a third of your level
8 +- 1 status bonus to non-Strike rolls with the attack trait

The duration is until the next daily preparations, or until an Alchemist removes the symbiote with Alchemist’s Tools and 1 minute. Hosting a lump, even if removed, provides immunity to and incompatibility with other lumps until the next day.

You gain the ability to carefully maximize the potential of your infused alchemical items. For any infused alchemical item with an Activate time less than a minute, you may instead spend 1 minute to Activate it. When done this way, the first roll of damage or healing dice automatically becomes the maximum possible roll.

If the infused item would be used to initialize a counteract check or otherwise trigger a d20 roll, the roll gains 1 untyped bonus to its result.

While compatible with more than simple healing elixirs, this delicate process only functions upon willing or helpless targets.

You enhance your Debilitating Additive. When you use the Debilitating Additive, you may now also select the following:

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}, or -10 ft status penalty to all speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.VUFqV5HhTanjuXcZ]{Effect: Greater Debilitating Siphon Speed Penality}

You understand the complex interactions of both material chemistry and that of primordial quintessences, and you use this to concoct alchemical items to meet your needs. This may be done with normal reagents and the Craft activity, and you can use special infused reagents that allow you to craft temporary items quickly and at no cost. Over time, you gain access to more items and boosting Additives, which steadily grows your power, leaving behind those who don't understand your strange science.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} feat, even if you don't meet that feat's prerequisites, and you gain the four common 1st-level alchemical formulas granted by that feat. You can use this feat to create alchemical items as long as you have the items' formulas in your formula book.

While under the effect of a mutagen, you can metabolize that mutagen’s power to heal yourself. You regain [[/r (3d4+3)[healing]]]{3d4 + 3 Hit Points} for every 3 item levels of the mutagen after Additives (minimum 3d4 + 3), but the mutagen’s effect immediately ends, regardless of the effect’s duration.

If this action is repeated within a minute of the last use, reduce the number of healing dice by 3 for each repetition, resetting only when a full minute has passed between uses.

Requirement Infused alchemical ammunition is mounted to the weapon with a 1 Action activation cost.

Your continued dabbling with projectile weapons has furthered your use of special alchemical ammunition. By affixing your alchemical ammunition to the weapon itself, a combination of rehearsal and other tweaks has improved the speed and performance of your self-made shots. With a deft maneuver, you both Activate the ammunition and Reload it into the weapon.

Mounting ammo to the weapon can be done with a single Interact action. When you become Expert in your class DC, you are able to mount a second shot to your weapon. When you become Master in your class DC, this increases again to a maximum of 3 mounted shots.

If you use Siphon Creation to create a shot of alchemical ammunition and are holding the weapon, the munition may be created into an empty mount instead of arriving in your hand.

Your ability to impede and cripple your foes with leftover creation has reached its peak. No matter what you select with the Debilitating Additive, the target only avoids the effect if it critically succeeds at its saving throw.

Each day during your daily preparations, you partially stabilize your reservoir’s outflow to produce a number of batches of infused reagents equal to your level + your Intelligence modifier. You can use these reagents for Infused Alchemy to create infused alchemical items, or they can be used to prepare additional daily reservoirs, described in each respective text. Together, all of your infused reagents have light Bulk.

As you make your daily preparations, your infused items and reagents from the previous day's preparations decompose. While infused reagents are physical objects, they can't be duplicated, preserved, or created in any way other than your daily preparations.

The reapplication of poisons is of the utmost importance to any would-be Toxicologist. While this clever innovation is quite useful, it does represent a signifcant trade-off.

In order to tube the toxin directly near the dangerous bits, the obstruction results in the weapon gaining a -2 penalty to damage while the talisman is affixed.

While affixed, the talisman provides the following free action:


Trigger Reapplicator f Flourish
Trigger the affixed weapon was manipulated

Whenever you involve the affxed weapon in a manipulate action, such as Interact, you have just enough time to trigger the mechanism to apply the injury poison for you. Once done, the small contraption falls off and no longer obstructs the weapon’s edge.

For example, if you use the Swap action to exchange a held dagger for a worn shortsword, if either weapon held a reapplicator, you could spring the mechanism to coat it in poison. However, as this item’s action is a flourish, you could only trigger one, even if both bore a reapplicator.
Add the discovery for your field to your Formula Book.

You may not always have the initiative needed to throw a bomb, and that is when this treasured armor adjustment shines. Typically fit atop a reinforced sleeve or other sturdy extremity, the mutual splasher mounts upon armor as per the adjustment trait. As part of the attachment process, you load in an existing bomb that does splash damage. This adjustment provides the following Reaction:

Present Bomb r 

Trigger You are targeted with a hostile action that targets your Armor Class, and you are not off-guard to your attacker.
 
Catching the blow with your bomb, it explodes just as contact is made. The bomb detonates inside your square. You take the bomb’s listed splash damage, and the force of the burst provides a +1 circumstance bonus to your Armor Class against the triggering effect.
 
For checking if the attacker is harmed, consider a melee attacking foe to be 5ft closer as they reach inside your square. If the Strike or attack was made with clearance from the splash, such as with a wielded reach weapon, the splash does not harm the attacker. Otherwise, the attacker takes the listed splash damage, and a -1 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.
 
The constraints of the device reduce the bomb’s splash distance to 5ft less than the bomb’s normal success; while some enhanced bombs may still splash beyond your square, the damage carries no on-hit nor splash effects the bomb might have. While the rest of your equipment is safe, the defensive explosion destroys the armor adjustment outright, and a new mutual splasher must be attached as a 10 minute activity via Alchemist’s Tools to use this action again.

Your Debilitating Additive is approaching its zenith. When your motes of essence affect foes, you may select from the following:

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, a -15 ft status penalty to all Speeds.

Instead of selecting one of the more potent debilitations, you may choose to limit your selection to the initial Debilitating Additive options in order to maximize the clinging stickiness. If you do this, the target only avoids the effect if the saving throw was a critical success.

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.KCXWTUksNn3IOM6C]{Effect: Major Debilitating Siphon Speed Penality}

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+1 status bonus to Reflex.

Trigger You create an infused item that triggers exposure events

Whenever the enhanced alchemical triggers an exposure event upon a creature, it suffers half of X poison damage and gains immunity to this Additive until the end of the current turn.

Trigger You create a bulk L infused alchemical item with the elixir trait, or that activates by simple topical application.

With a some dedicated experimentation and a new shape charge, you have discovered a means to turn some of your alchemical items into bombs without altering their function. Simple alchemical tools that need only be unleashed or smeared upon their target like Emetic Paste, Camouflage Dye, or inhaled poisons, are compatible with this Additive. Items that require precise application, such as injury poisons, are not.

The item gains the bomb trait, and has a base range increment of 15ft. You may no longer Interact to Activate the item, and must Strike with it. This takes the same number of Actions as the item’s Activation entry.

Unwilling targets require a successful Strike or better to bomb their square. Willing targets are considered off-guard to your Strikes, and such Strikes succeed on a miss, but not critical miss. A typical square of flat terrain is considered to have an AC of 10, and the bomb Strike functions on a success or better.

Trigger You create an infused item with the healing trait, elixir trait, or is consumed orally

If the item does not restore Hit Points, then it now restores X Hit Points when it takes effect. Otherwise, increase the value of its Hit Point recovery by X. If multiple targets would receive this healing simultaneously, it is reduced to half of X rounded up.
Your alchemical concoctions are the stuff of stories. Your proficiency rank for your alchemist class DC increases to legendary.

You have built upon your understanding of the basic smoke ball to create a flexible Additive that can provide concealing smoke in all manner of ways at no additional action cost. Gain the following @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Z18FSVIe2zTJr2q7]{Smokescreen} additive.

Trigger You use Siphon Creation with a full reservoir, the item does not have the Bottomless Additive.

A new discovery enables you to keep a drop of Time within your first Reservoir of Quintessence for a special Additive. You are only able to maintain a single drop of Time, which is held in your primary reservoir and refills in parallel at the same 10 minute rate.

This Additive enables you to use your Alchemy to bend time in your favor, just a little. If the item is eligible for multiple of the below, select only one.

Invoke the Future Present If the item is used in an attack, you make the attack at MAP 0. Your next turn begins with your Multiple Attack Penalty as if you had made the attack in that round.

Double-Time It For 3 turns, accelerate the item’s effects. Effects that typically reoccur each round now happen twice, subtracting duration and/or performing checks as needed. This typically means at both the beginning and end of a target's turn.

Afflict with Pluperfect When the alchemical item harms a foe, the first foe affected makes a basic @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your Alchemist DC , with the following results for the target’s next turn. This effect has the incapacitation trait:

Critical Success No effect.

Success Each attack action adds 2 more to the MAP than normal.

Failure Their next turn will begin with the same MAP that they ended the turn with.

Critical Failure Both Success and Failure effects.

Trigger You use Siphon Creation and the item can make hostile contact with a target.

When you perform Siphon Creation, you are able to preserve and deliver some self-contradictory essences that cause temporary debilitation upon exposure. The first target affected by a Debilitating item fights against the orphan bits of creation and makes a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.classDC.value)] saving throw against your Alchemist DC . This effect only occurs once per created item. 

Upon failure, the Additive inflicts an effect of your selection until the end of your next turn, these are: 
-5 ft status penalty to speeds, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.k2r4vGQnu7n6qaId]{Effect: Debilitating Siphon Speed Penality}

Trigger You create an infused item with the bomb trait

If the item has listed splash damage, it now increases bonus damage on hit by the same amount. Add or increase the bonus damage on hit by half of X. The item loses the splash trait and splash effects if it has them. Thrown weapons without the splash trait add your Strength modifier to damage.

Alchemist Repeated exposure to toxic reagents has fortified your body against poisons of all kinds.

Alchemist Reformulated Your body has become fortified against toxins.

Druid Your affinity for the natural world grants you protection against some of its dangers.

You gain poison resistance equal to half your level, and you gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against poisons.

Trigger You create an infused item that does energy damage.

By injecting the item with a touch of your will, the item’s dangerous expulsions curve to avoid harming whomever you wish. When you use this enhanced item, you may choose to have its energy related effects harmlessly bypass whatever creatures or objects you wish.

The item gains the ephemeral trait.

While at first glance these black pimples may seem organic in nature, these pressurized sacks are carefully crafted and glued in key locations.

When you receive physical damage, half of the blisters pop with enough force to splash the @Template[type:line|distance:5] adjacent to you that is closest to the attacker. This deals @Damage[(2[splash])[poison]] splash damage, and splashed creatures receive a -1 status penalty to saves against your alchemical effects until the end of your next turn. This is considered a poison exposure event, but there is no affliction, only the prior effect.

After this is triggered twice, the item is expended.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.WhJTCyes8A7KXKEI]{Prophylactic Fortifications}

The target gains the ability to add a +1 status bonus to any saving throw it makes. This bonus persists for X rounds, but utilizing the bonus subtracts 2 turns from the remaining duration.

This minor concoction accelerates all sorts of bodily functions. One minute after consumption, the uncomfortable swirling of one's insides subsides, and all active effects with a duration tied to the target’s life will act as if one day has passed, including magical curses, but not recovery tied to activities such as bed rest. Any afiction will trigger its next stage only once due to this item, and subtract just that interval from its duration. If an affliction stage is longer than a day, this item can be carefully administered over an hour to trigger the affliction’s progression regardless of the normal time frame. The target is then immune to your Metabolic Accelerant for two days, or a week if it was administered over an hour.

Trigger You create an infused injury or ingested poison

When Strikes themselves prove difficult, this Additive provides a Toxicologist an alternative avenue of exposure. As is normal for the inhaled trait, each cloud only inflicts an exposure event once per creature. A second identical cloud overwrites the previous cloud square by square, but is a new effect with a different exposure event.

The Additive replaces the injury or ingested trait with the inhaled trait.

The cloud remains airborne for 4 turns.

The effects of the final stage of the affliction are downgraded; replace the final affliction stage with a copy of the stage preceding it. The listed duration of the final affliction stage is unchanged.

Trigger You create an inused item that is consumed orally.

You have discovered an entirely new type of synergistic additive! Yet, no matter how you tweak the shapes of the essences, the result is… unpleasant to consume. While this Additive may have appeal to the gambler, be sure the full equation of consequence is known.

This wondrous Additive does not contribute to the item’s limited number of Additives, but does change the total item level.

After the base item’s effects are resolved upon consumption, the subject makes a DC 13 @Check[type:flat|dc:13] against the horrid taste, adding any bonuses to saves against sickening effects to the roll. If failed, the subject becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The DC to recover is your Alchemist DC -1 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.classDC.value)|adjustment:-1].

As normal, the Sickened condition prevents the consumption of comestibles such as elixirs. If the Gross item is a lozenge, the save occurs after the bite.

Requirement A Research Field

By dedicating some time to study outside your native Research Field, you gain a minor discovery of that field, and a unique discovery that represents a potent fusion of your selection with your primary Research Field. See your Research Fields for details.

Other Field Shared Discovery Fusion Discovery
Bomber @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.AqwFUhXwlmdyazs3]{Mutual Splasher} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.YoKqDooDyx65L2w3]{Morphic Softener}
Chirurgeon @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.WhJTCyes8A7KXKEI]{Prophylactic Fortifications} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.y3uwrTJL1K77LTis]{Tough Teratoma}
Toxicologist @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Hfs4lYBWycIWfJcV]{Black Blisters} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.lDfW9wxjbSl2zyFW]{Venom Glands}

This crafty creation enables you to deploy leftover mutagenics directly upon the target’s sensory organs. When affixed to armor, the squeeze-ready bladder can be activated to squirt upon a creature within 10 feet. If your target is beyond that, some fluid is lost with distance, and the Fortitude save suffers a -1 DC for every 5 further feet, and is unable to reach beyond 30 feet.

If affixed to a melee or unarmed weapon, it may be activated just after the weapon makes contact with a successful roll to invoke the item’s save. However it is used, the activation requires 1 manipulate Action that is not connected to the Multiple Attack Penalty.

Despite the normal talisman rules, this item can be affixed to bombs. When done, this instead requires 1 manipulate action to be committed before the Strike, and on hit or better, the squirt’s Fortitude save is invoked just after the throw is resolved.

When the squirt connects, the target makes a basic @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.classDC.value)] save with the following results:

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of the alchemist’s next turn.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 4 rounds.
All results grant immunity to disorienting squirt for the next minute.

items.name: Effect: Major Debilitating Siphon Speed Penality

description.value:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.BCSgtbKsMAKAlS5K]{Major Debilitation}

-15-ft status penalty to its speeds until end of your next turn.
A new breakthrough in your alchemical stability enables you to mix a third Additive into your items. The total number value must still be within your budget.

Requirements You can Strike with a bomb that deals splash damage and also make a second throw.

With impossible precision, you can use the explosion of a bomb to propel and redirect a second throw. Make a Strike with the initial bomb. On any result other than a critical failure, you may make a second Strike against a different creature, treating the original creature's square as the origin point for the throw. On a critical failure, the action is wasted but you retain the secondary bomb.

This explosive technique provides +2 circumstance bonus to the attack and damage rolls of the second throw.

Trigger A creature within 30 feet critically fails its saving throw against a poison you created.

With carefully engineered enzymes, you coax some of your poison to infect another target, using the original victim as a carrier. A creature you select within 10 ft of the triggering creature is exposed to the triggering poison.

Trigger you create an infused item with the morph or polymorph trait

When you consume this item, it no longer counts toward your single morph or polymorph effect limit, nor can the effect be targeted to be counteracted by an outside actor.

If you consume any second naturalized item while one is still in effect, cancel all the benefits and double the numerical values of both sets of drawbacks. When the shorter of the two durations expires, end both.

This wondrous Additive does not contribute toward the number of Additives your items may be enhanced with, but does add to the limited budget.

Trigger You used Siphon Creation to create an infused alchemical item and have infused reagents available.

By combining your infused reagents with your Siphon Creation, you can manifest items before their time. Gain formulas as if you had increased your level twice, and continue to treat your future formula acquisition as if you were two levels higher.

Your ability to manifest unstable creation defies normalcy even among Alchemists. By adding 1 of your infused reagents during Siphon Creation, you can create things that should be beyond you. The base level of items eligible for this Siphon Creation is 2 levels higher than normal.

items.name: Effect: Symbiotic Lump (Penality to Armor Class)

description.value:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+1 status penality to AC.

Discovering a new exploit, you can use Siphon Creation to hasten and compress the process of Infused Alchemy into mere moments.

If you perform Siphon Creation and drain a reservoir, you may instead perform Infused Alchemy as if you had spent 10 minutes with Alchemist’s Tools on the process. The created item(s) may be in hand or stowed on your person. You must have your Alchemist’s Tools available, as is normal for Infused Alchemy.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.WVJdEjP0NJUKzSN3]{Nurse Gabby}

For 1 minute after activation, the dutiful nurse provides Fast Healing 3.

Trigger You create an infused bomb

You have unified your interest in projectile weapons with your personal mini-bombs. Encasing your alchemical bombs inside aerodynamic sabots enables you to use them directly as alchemical ammunition, but even alchemy has its limits.

The altered item is a unit of alchemical ammunition with a 1 Action Interact activation cost. The bomb deals 1 less damage die than normal. If this would be 0 dice, then it is instead 1 damage.

When firing a sabot bomb, the weapon deals its normal damage alongside the bomb. The bomb deals its splash and secondary effects normally.
You've trained to more effectively wield the weapons you find in your lab. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, unarmed attacks, and alchemical bombs increase to expert.

Requirement A Research Field

By dedicating some time to study outside your native Research Field, you gain a minor discovery of that field, and a unique discovery that represents a potent fusion of your selection with your primary Research Field. See your Research Fields for details.

Other Field Shared Discovery Fusion Discovery
Bomber @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.fiXwAv69hO0yiz9w]{Gravel Bomb} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.WteJecle37r0mrKl]{Barbed Casing}
Mutagenist @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.l6nteFKC7pfHG33w]{Syringe Hooks} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.lDfW9wxjbSl2zyFW]{Venom Glands}
Toxicologist @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Dot24s9ZmbMY9Qwx]{Medicinal Boost} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.3EGyVMirAAcyLGhu]{Chemotherapeutic Curative}

Trigger You create an infused elixir that is not ephemeral

If the elixir has a duration, double its duration.

If there is an Additive elixir, it will also be enhanced by this Additive.

You may optionally expend an infused reagent during creation to attempt to entangle the elixir with your own essence for an indefinite duration. To achieve this incredible feat, your Additive budget must allow for the Extended’s 4, plus the item’s level after other Additives. When altered like this, only you can consume the creation.

Drinking a second indefinite elixir replaces the effects of the first.

value.value: Additive Elixirs or elixir reservoir trait

description.value:
Your persistent efforts have been rewarded with your first taste of infinite creation. You can pull simple items that you have outgrown from your reservoir endlessly at no cost. An empty reservoir may still be used for this purpose, and a full one is not emptied. Any lingering effects created by these items, such an antiplague’s protection, are unable to persist, and will disappear after 1 minute. By default, references or requirements of Siphon Creation are interchangeable with Bottomless Creation.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Item.tziSBBs5Dxo858Jf]{Bottomless Creation} activity.
Add the discovery for your field to your Formula Book.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.yC3ZrMCNzGH0qrHu]{Exsanguinating Carcinogen}

The triggering attack deals its damage dice as normal, but inflicts no flat bonus to damage from Strength or other sources. Instead, the target gains or increases their weakness to bleeding damage by 1 for every 3 bonus damage converted.

Any turn in which the boil-riddled opponent takes precision damage, they suffer 1 persistent bleeding damage, or increase an existing bleed by 1.

While a boil is present, only you may take a -2 penalty to attack rolls to aim for the tumor, which will convert any physical Strike damage into precision damage.

Only one boil may affect a foe at a time. After a minute the alchemical energies fade, and the flesh reverts to normal.

Your inquiries into the alchemical nature of the universe have led you to focus on a particular field of research. You may have a degree from a medical institute, privately correspond with secretive mutagenic researchers, or slowly synthesize toxins as a brilliant loner. Whatever background, your motivation to leave the laboratory and risk your precious fingers in the chaos of combat distinguishes you from your Alchemist peers.

In addition to an Alchemist, selecting a Research Field will label you as an explosive Bomber, a medicinal Chiurgeon, a polymorphic Mutagenist, or as a poisonous Toxicologist.

Your research field adds a small list of special alchemical discoveries to your formula book as you level up. These are made of your personal essences, causing the unique recipes to only have meaning to you. While the ephemeral items lack impact by themselves, they can be paired with potent Additives and freely made with a minute of Infused Alchemy.

Trigger You create an infused alchemical item that inflicts energy damage via Strike, or that invokes a saving throw via hostile effect.

The preserved sparks of creation force glimpses of alchemy’s true potential into your awestruck foes. On a successful Strike or failed save, the first target affected by the item is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by you for 1 round. On a critically successful Strike or critically failed save, that target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned}.

Trigger You are holding an infused bomb that inflicts damage.

The bomb gains 1 additional damage die and increases any splash damage by 2.

You may use 1 non-attack Interact action to heave it toward your foes. The thrown bomb detonates within 40 ft of you in a 30 ft radius burst. The bomb is so large that if you use a second hand to assist the throw, the range increment is 60 ft and the high arc nullifies cover as the GM determines.

You may throw the bomb further and invoke a -2 penalty to the DC as if using a thrown weapon’s range increment.

All creatures affected make a basic Reflex save. If a target is able to upgrade its Reflex save success beyond a critical success, it takes no splash damage. All targets with a lesser save result suffer full splash damage and splash effects, as well as the following:
Critical Success No other effect.
Success Half Strike damage.
Failure Full Strike damage, and bomb on-hit effects.
Critical Failure Double Strike damage, and bomb on-hit effects.

This wondrous Additive does not contribute toward the number of Additives your items may be enhanced with.

A Giant bomb is unstable, and will dissolve like any item created via Siphon Creation.
Your alchemical concoctions are incredibly effective. Your proficiency rank for your alchemist class DC increases to master.
With a practiced flourish, you snatch everything you need. You may fill one or both hands up to their limit with bulk L items.

By means unknown even to you, your healing alchemy contains tiny motes of true Health. You can administer your infused True Elixirs of Life to creatures who have been dead for no more than 3 rounds. When done, the elixir restores them to life with 1 Hit Point and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 1} condition before the normal effects of the elixir occur. Lingering conditions and effects that require a living target do not reapply to the revived creature, and all persistent damage is nullified as if the check passed. Any creature revived by this effect is immune to it for 8 hours.

Any target corpse that has been dismembered in a simple manner, such as decapitation, can be revived as a 3 action activity involving putting parts in the right places before administering the elixir. Missing limbs are not regrown.
Constant practice has increased the effectiveness of your concoctions. Your proficiency rank for your alchemist class DC increases to expert.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+5-foot status bonus to speed.

Your mastery of alchemical secrets enables you to replicate effects most believe can be achieved only via magic. Select a number of potions equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1); these potions must be of 9th level or lower.

You gain formulas to create these potions as alchemical items with the elixir trait. When making these alchemical elixirs, you can substitute alchemical reagents for an equal value of magical components, and you can use alchemist's tools or an alchemist's lab instead of any other required tool kits. Other than that, the formula does not change.

After you have decided the potion formulas, you may expend 2 infused reagents during daily preparations to permanently exchange 1 magical potion formula for another. This Feat can also be retrained into itself to reselect all potions at once.

Countless hours working with hands overfull of glassware might have been “unsafe,” but it has provided a key benefit. You have adapted yourself to the use of bulk L items. When all are bulk L or less, you can hold multiple at a time, and your hands are considered full if they carry 2 each. When carrying fewer, they are considered free hands for most purposes, but not wielding melee weapons nor for Strength-dependent Actions or maneuvers, such as Grapple.

A hand used in this way maintains the dexterity needed for ranged Strikes, including thrown weapons, but such Strikes loose any benefit of Strength.

Any Interact Action involving the items work normally, but they only affect 1 item in your hand.

When you gain Expert in Alchemy, each hand can carry 3, and 4 when Master. Additionally, you gain @UUID[Item.TQGv9vRcMIDyOV5Q]{Full-Fingered Draw} activity

You have learned Artokus Kirran's most hidden secrets, granting you the ability to create alchemy infused with the power of wishes. Once per day when you use Infused Alchemy during your daily preparations, you can spend a batch of infused reagents to create a wish vial containing a single arcane spell, either any common spell or one you otherwise have prior access to. It must be 8th rank or lower. You either drink this spell, or mindfully unleash the magic in a square adjacent yourself. The spell must have a casting time of no more than 10 minutes, no Cost, and the only creature it may directly target is yourself. Only you can Activate the wish vial, which takes the same number of Interact actions as the spell's casting time.

Requirements You are holding an infused item of your creation with a trait that matches your reservoir.

You strike the item against your reservoir of quintessence to ring it like a tuning fork. Once initiated, the supercritical crescendo cannot be stopped. Until your next turn, the item cannot be Activated.

At the start of your next turn, the base item’s Hit Point-affecting numbers are increased by half. For altering the number of rolled dice, round down with a minimum of 1 die difference.

At the end of your turns while the unstable item exists, roll a flat check with a DC equal to 2 + the number of flat checks passed. On a critical success, the level value of all Additives increases by 2. On a success, the level value of all Additives increases by 1. On a failure, the item explodes, dealing you the listed damage of a Thunderstone Strike of the equivalent item level.

If you used Siphon Creation to make this item, this crescendo can be initiated freely as part of creating the item. Doing so causes the item to remain potent and to persist while the resonance is ongoing, but the DC instead increases by 2 for each passed check.

If you end your turn with an unattended resonating item, it becomes inert. If you attempt to start a second resonance while one is ongoing, the first item immediately explodes as if a failed check occurred.

Trigger You create an infused item with the morph or polymorph trait

While in effect, the item grants an additional reaction that can only be used for the following reaction

Trigger A turn begins

Anticipating danger, your body surges with adrenaline to destabilize the alchemy coursing within your veins. At the end of the triggering turn, all non-permanent efects of the item end as if its duration had elapsed.

items.name: Effect: Greater Debilitating Siphon Speed Penality

description.value:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.8UEzLr9CYpGTXzsx]{Greater Debilitation}

-10-ft status penalty to its speeds until end of your next turn.

Trigger You create an infused poison, or a poison-adjacent infused item that inflicts biological harm.

The item gains the mental trait. If it invoked a Fortitude save, it now invokes a Will save. If it is a poison that already invoked a Will save, any affliction gains the virulent trait.

Your body itself has begun to respond to the euphoria of change. When you are first affected by a morph or polymorph effect, you immediately gain a single quickened action that may be used for any move action that lack the attack trait.

You have finally managed to increase your ability to gather quintessence of pure Time. Even if you are reaching the peak of alchemical prowess, this discovery only highlights just how little you know of this new branch of Alchemy, and you feel driven to investigate further.

Instead of only your primary reservoir containing a drop of Time, all your reservoirs are able to hold one. Additionally, if you do not use Siphon Creation with your primary reservoir for an hour, that drop grows to a thimbleful. When this full thimble is used, it creates a Timely+ Additive that adds these options to the previous list.

Fork the Future The first roll of a die invoked by the item, such as an attack roll or saving throw, is done twice. Use the result you prefer. This is a fortune or misfortune effect accordingly.

Break the Sequence Activating or using the item dislodges you from timespace. The moment before or after the item is used, you may move up to your speed. This occurs outside time, and appears to be a teleportation effect that does not trigger reactions, trap mechanisms, etc. As it is not truly a teleportation effect, spells like Dimensional Anchor will not prevent it.

Bank the Present You appear to use the item normally, but the action vanishes into the future just before impact. You must commit to using the item on a target or in a manner that is presently valid and spend the actions to do so. Make a note of the present modifers needed for any roll, but do not make the roll. For the next minute, you may pull that thread of Time as a free action with the concentrate trait to realize the prior action. Any consideration of the target no longer being valid still behaves as if it was the noted moment when the action was banked.

You have used alchemy to create life, a simple creature formed from alchemical materials, reagents, and a bit of your own blood. This alchemical familiar appears to be a small creature of flesh and blood, though it might have some unusual or distinguishing aspects depending on your creative process. The familiar is of homuncularin origin, and you may choose for it to be an animal, beast, or construct. The familiar uses your Intelligence modifier to determine its Perception, Acrobatics, and Stealth modifiers.

Imbuing your medicines with a pseudo-life of their own, this helpful flubbery thing defies proper categorization. The lime-green gelatin can be used as a normal Interact, or thrown like a bomb attack with a 10ft range increment. Willing targets are off-guard to you. On a miss or better, the item sticks and activates correctly.

When activated, the gelatin reshapes itself into a Tiny insect or other sturdy-gripped climber.The nurse thoughtlessly seeks out injuries, and steadily depletes its own volume while administering its healing body. For 1 minute after activation, the dutiful nurse provides Fast Healing 3.

If the nurse has the Medicinal Additive, the Fast Healing value is increased by half of the Additive level rounded up instead of its normal function.

The scurrying nurse’s effect is obvious to all observers, along with its fragility and unobservant nature. If the patient under a nurse’s care receives any damage from an outside source, even if reduced to 0, the nurse is splattered, and the effect ends.

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.PgtR15n8u3inQV5p]{Effect: Nurse Gabby}

Trigger You create an infused item with the healing trait, elixir trait, or that is consumed orally.

Proactive prevention is typically superior to reactive tending, and this discovery will greatly help with such a strategy. Whenever a creature is first exposed to the infused item, it gains the ability to add a +1 status bonus to any saving throw it makes. This bonus persists for X rounds, but utilizing the bonus subtracts 2 turns from the remaining duration.

@UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Item.Hrc5NfjKTnq0vPbp]{Effect: Prophylactic Fortifications}

Increasing the potency within your reservoir of quintessence enables you to make more powerful items when you use Siphon Creation.

When you use Siphon Creation, your potential total item level is 3 higher than normal. This does not increase the base level of items eligible for Siphon Creation, but does enable more potent Additives. If you are a Master in your alchemist class DC, this increases to 4, and 5 if Legendary.

Trigger You create an infused bomb that deals damage on Strike and have an injury poison ready.

Veined barbs await the dose of poison. The level of this Barbed Additive is equal to half the poison’s total level after Additives.

When a Strike succeeds and deals damage, the target is exposed to the injury poison. The delivery method of the poison leaves much to be desired, and the DC of any poison delivered this way suffers a -1 penalty. Add the ephemeral trait to the item.

Special You also gain the Harmful Exposure additive if you are a Bomber, or the Gravel Bomb ephemeral if you are a Toxicologist. You may only have a single Field Fusion feat at a time.

Granted by @UUID[Item.AEoAa4EMIJTpvEkJ]{Ready Reapplicator}

In order to tube the toxin directly near the dangerous bits, the obstruction results in the weapon gaining a -2 penalty to damage while the talisman is affixed.

Whenever you involve the affxed weapon in a manipulate action, such as Interact, you have just enough time to trigger the mechanism to apply the injury poison for you. Once done, the small contraption falls off and no longer obstructs the weapon’s edge.

Trigger You create an infused item with the healing trait that is consumed orally or via bloodstream.

If the target is suffering from a poison, disease, or any other GM approved biological ill, immediately make the next scheduled saving throw, and that ill becomes immune to this effect. If the patient does not wish to use the result, ignore the attempt.

If the ill is duration based, instead subtract 1 turn from the duration.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.nukUHrSvlgIU0HNJ]{Mr. Mister}

Any creature that begins its turn within or enters a misted square gains 2 temporary Hit Points that fade at the end of their next turn.
You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion. You Interact to draw a weapon, then Strike with that weapon.

Trigger You create an infused bomb that inflicts energy damage

By uniting the two Research Fields, you have discovered a way for your alchemical energies themselves to carry mutagenic effects that continually weaken foes with repeated exposure.

If a foe has an energy damage resistance invoked by a Softening bomb, that resistance is reduced by 2 for the next minute. Any weakness triggered by the bomb increases by 1. The softening takes place before the bomb’s damage is resolved. This effect can grow with repeated exposure to more Softening bombs. After 1 minute without being exposed to a Softening bomb, the resistance and weakness reset.

Add the ephemeral trait to the item.

Special You also gain the Disorienting Squirt ephemeral if you're a Bomber, or the Mutual Splasher ephemeral if you're a Mutagenist. You may only have a single Field Fusion feat at a time.

You concentrate on crafting and administering beneficial alchemicals. The core trait of your reservoir is healing. As you increase your Alchemist level, add the below discoveries to your Formula Book. 

As a Chiurgeon, you may use your proficiency rank in Crafting for anything that requires a proficiency rank in Medicine (such as Feat prerequisites), and can use your Crafting modifier in place of your Medicine modifier for all Medicine checks. When substituting Crafting for a Medicine check, you may use your Intelligence bonus while electing to use either your other bonuses to Crafting or to Medicine.

If a feature of any Background, Ancestry, or other would improve your Medicine proficiency, you may instead improve your Crafting.

Level 1 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.kFaAeT5iqsH0OkTk]{Proactive Patch}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Dot24s9ZmbMY9Qwx]{Medicinal Boost}

Level 3 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.nukUHrSvlgIU0HNJ]{Mr. Mister}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.WhJTCyes8A7KXKEI]{Prophylactic Fortifications}

Level 5 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.I3lGfuqr0JMlZgro]{Metabolic Accelerant}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Y2k2aW0q3AhPTWmJ]{Detoxifying Cleanser}

Level 7 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.WVJdEjP0NJUKzSN3]{Nurse Gabby}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.IZtAa4gAdUnh2YAe]{Gross Potency}

Trigger You create an infused item that fits one of the three forms explained below.

However the dense pellet is attached to the item and triggered, the smoker bursts with a 5 ft radius from an available corner of your choice. For every 3 levels of X, add 5 additional ft to the radius. The smoke effect is otherwise as described in the smoke ball item, with thick smoke providing concealment.

String-Puller With the pellet strung to its resting place, this pull-start fuse activates when you first Draw the item off your belt, remove it from a containter, etcetera. Usable for all base items.

Cork-Popper The alchemical smoker will react with fresh air once the conjoined item is activated. Usable for all orally ingested items, inhaled poisons, and other GM approved forms.

Yolk-Smasher The smoker is placed in a sturdy-ish shell, and ready to be thrown. Usable with bombs or other items that experience significant breakage with normal use. The cloud is located wherever the smoker experiences that breakage.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+1 status bonus to Fortitude saves.
With a major breakthrough, you have become able to mix an additional Additive into your items without spoiling them. The sum of both Additives must still be within your limit.

Trigger It is not your turn. An action that you have awareness of ends.

Grumbling under your breath absentmindedly, your feet begin moving as soon as you recognize that you have yet another task added to your list. Become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of your turn. Make a Step or Stride. Then, perform 1 Action that has the manipulate trait. This happens immediately, but the Action is taken out of your next turn. Considerations like flourish or the Multiple Attack Penalty will apply in your next turn. The movement cannot be performed without a subsequent action.

When the sticky shell of this egg-like item is broken just right, the bubbling center evaporates as a steady stream of medicinal mist. The mister cannot be attached to patients, and must be used upon terrain or equivalent.

Using this item is considered a 1 Action attack that increases the Multiple Attack Penalty. When targeting squares outside reach, there is the potential for failure, and the throw uses the statistics of a bomb with a 10ft range increment. Consider the AC of a typical square to be 10, but specific circumstances, such hitting a narrow beam beneath a balancing Rogue, may cause the GM to change this.

On a Success or better, the mister is thrown to stick to a square of floor or wall, and fills the adjacent 5ft cube with fortifying mist for 3 rounds.

Your Bomber focus inverts the helpful nature of this device. When you create a Mr. Mister (B), consume an existing bomb. The mister looses the healing trait and gains the bomb trait. This item inherits the Additives of the component bomb, and cannot itself be enhanced by Additives.

For each exposure, the misted creature makes a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] against the bomb’s splash damage. On fail, it also suffers the bomb’s Strike effects, while gaining immunity to repeat effects, but not damage.

Trigger You create an infused alchemical item with the poison trait.

Poison immune foes are the bane of Toxicologists the world over. By infusing your creations with some reactive variability, you are able to adapt your poisons to remove the poison trait and bypass relevant immunity.

The item lacks the poison trait for the sake of saving throws, exposure events, and affliction stages. Any poison damage is still poison type, but disregards immunity. Other exposure requirements, such as inflicting slashing or piercing damage for injury poisons, still apply.

The DC for a creature to notice an Adaptive poison, such as within food before consumption, is 3 higher.

Trigger You create an infused alchemical item with a radial, line, cone, or splash effect.

By tweaking the formula a bit, you are able to alter and direct the resulting shapes of your more energetic alchemical creations. Exchange the item’s normal area of effect for a cone or a line of equal distance.

If the created item is a bomb, the line or central line of the cone when thrown may only point in any direction that is in the 180 degree arc opposite from you, not back toward yourself.

If the base item’s effect was a splash or radial area, increase the distance of any output cone by 5ft, and the distance of any line by 10ft.

If you are a Master in alchemist class DC, you may also choose a double-wide line that is 10ft wide in exchange for reaching half the line’s normal distance.

Whether it is tubed directly to your vein and vitae, or it is intangibly paired with a personal aeon stone you wear on your forehead, this signature vessel you carry whorls with unfinished creation. The source of your infused reagents, you are able to freely prepare a single reservoir that is aligned to the core trait specified in your Research Field.

Each day, you are able to extract and stabilize some of this raw potential from the reservoir, creating your infused reagents. Utilizing this processed quintessence for item creation is Infused Alchemy.

Instead of readying 2 infused reagents each, you may reallocate the effort to instead create and wear additional reservoirs. These function identically to your first.

While worn, empty reservoirs slowly refill over 10 minutes as they leech your quintessence, with no need to attend them. Without involving Infused Alchemy, you can drain the reservoir to hastily create a single infused item. It will not persist long, but the excess of creation boosts the item’s Additive potency. For as long as the instant item or its created effects linger, the reservoir it came from will not replenish. With an Interact action, you can “restart” the reservoir; any ongoing effect, such as a smoke ball’s cloud, will immediately vanish and the reservoir will begin to refill.

It is the final item and its traits that determine eligibility for Siphon Creation or other Additives. A typical Bomber with a reservoir only matching the bomb trait could not use Siphon Creation to make an elixir. However, if that Bomber used the Additive provided by the Explosive Delivery Alchemist Feat to alter the item, the addition of the bomb trait would cause such special elixirs to match the reservoir.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Item.24WfTvQ4rX0hOxVR]{Siphon Creation} activity.

You specialize in the energies that fuel energetic alchemical reactions, typically in explosive form. The core trait of your Reservoir is bomb. As you increase your Alchemist level, add the following discoveries
to your Formula Book.

Level 1 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.fiXwAv69hO0yiz9w]{Gravel Bomb}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.FsjoYSnvnkzOShlQ]{Heavy}

Level 3 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.slx8jCi0nYYeI1fV]{Splash Pack}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.GjWtlNR5BBSiMtCn]{Friendly Fires}

Level 5 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.AqwFUhXwlmdyazs3]{Mutual Splasher}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.3iDtocvA0ny9J0A8]{Expanded Energies}

Level 7 Discovery

Ephermeral Item @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.1ZtvoghddjQl2cjf]{Twirl Cordage}

Additive @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.z3bXrEQSMi5HWHBe]{Shower Bomb}

Your creations are further empowered by matching your core trait. When you use Siphon Creation or Infused Alchemy to create an item, it adds 2 to its Additive budget for each trait of the item that matches your reservoir.

Activate 1 Interact

The leftover syrups and molasses of your infused poisons lack potency, but they are plentiful. You have also discovered that this toxic treat is quite delicious and sweet. The affliction is rather minor, but has the odd property of being quite “sticky” to one’s constitution. When ingested, the treacle gains an onset time of half a minute. 

While the treacle does not damage the device, it gums up any Poison Concentrator to the point of uselessness. The thick treacle is considered to not be a liquid for items such as Ready Reapplicators, and is incompatible.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15]

Maximum Duration 1 minute

Stage 1 @Damage[(1d4+1)[poison]], +1 to the DC of the affliction at this stage

Stage 2 @Damage[(1d4+2)[poison]]

Stage 3 @Damage[(1d4+3)[poison]]

Stage 4 @Damage[(1d4+4)[poison]]

Stage 5 @Damage[(1d4+5)[poison]]

Trigger You create an infused item that causes an affliction.

When immediate toxic harm is not the first consideration, a boost to the debilitation is the next place the mind travels. While seemingly minor, the affliction listed for this Additive is conjoined to the enhanced item; whenever a creature is suffering from the base item’s affliction of a certain stage, it is also suffering the additional effects of the same stage listed here. If the base item does not have 5 affliction stages, you may add 1 additional affliction stage that is a copy of the previous stage.

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}
Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}
Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}
Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} & @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}
Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} & @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}

Requirement A Research Field

By dedicating some time to study outside your native Research Field, you gain a minor discovery of that field, and a unique discovery that represents a potent fusion of your selection with your primary Research Field. See your Research Fields for details.

Other Field Shared Discovery Fusion Discovery
Chirugeon @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.adjKz0GkSmgAFTTr]{Mr. Mister (B)} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.iDZsoLv3GfxMgTEe]{Thunderstone Glassware}
Mutagenist @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.JwsE6ERIlq72X189]{Disorienting Squirt} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.YoKqDooDyx65L2w3]{Morphic Softener}
Toxicologist @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.BfVAd2llhhsxll8Q]{Harmful Exposure} @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.WteJecle37r0mrKl]{Barbed Casing}

Trigger You used Siphon Creation to make an infused item that has the elixir trait, healing trait, or is orally consumed. You have 1 or more infused reagents within reach.

By expending 1 infused reagent into the creation of this special Additive, you have found a way to bend your rules, and can turn elixirs themselves into Additives for your items.

Create a second alchemical item with Siphon Creation, modifying it as normal with additives. This item then becomes a single additive for the triggering item, treating its additive level as one and a half times its item level. Additives given to either item affect the effects of only that item- an additive on the triggering item will not modify the effects of the additive elixir.
Add the discovery for your field to your Formula Book.

Your leftover crusts of alchemical detritus may be ill-suited for a proper bomb, but it is simple enough to align the knotted energies into a minor explosive. This bomb detonates to deal 2 energy damage of a type available to you, and 1 bludgeoning splash damage. The energy type is decided upon creation, and is added as a trait.

Requirements you have 4 infused bestial mutagens within reach

By means of a scarcely-controlled mutagenic overdose, you have discovered a way to fully transform yourself. You become a bulky, unnatural beast with visible hints of your original body, gaining the effects of cat form as per the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spell. You may heighten the effects when they take place, up to half your level rounded up.

The mutagenic recoil immediately causes a lingering and unpredictable maleffect. Roll a d4 and suffer either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} accordingly. This effect persists either until you rest or you receive treatment able to counteract the condition, using your class DC as the affliction DC. You may potentially suffer multiple of these at once due to repeated uses of this ability, but repeated rolls cannot increase an affliction beyond a value of 1.

Muscular spasms cause you to drop anything held in your hands before the change completes. If the form is bipedal, you are prone when you regain control. This is not a spell, and cannot be dismissed or dispelled.

As a part of this activity, you may consume an additional mutagen within reach during the change, applying that mutagen’s additives, benefits, and drawbacks to the new form and ending its effects when the form does.

After obtaining this feat, you may use your Alchemist’s Tools to collect samples of fresh creatures. You may later analyze their forms and add them to your formula book as if you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Q5iIYCFdqJFM31GW]{Learn a Spell}, with a DC equal to the creature's level. If it is a living creature with biology and there is a fitting battle form spell with a level equal to or less than half your level rounded up, you may use that form's statistics instead of animal form.

Special If player and GM both agree and desire a more risky mutagenic experience, the following optional rule may be used, or edited to personal taste.

When you enter a battle form granted by Polymorphing Overdose, the GM rolls a secret flat check of 3 + 2 for each prior overdose that day. Upon failure, the GM rolls a secret d10 and you suffer the effect as listed below. Neutralizing Rush cannot remove these effects. Malfunctions may last moments, minutes, or hours, but the complication should not generally prevent adventuring outright. 8 hours of rest, a polymorph effect, a counteract check against your class DC using Alchemist’s Tools, or other treatment are a few possible ways to nullify or shorten the malingering malfunctions, at GM discretion.

1 When your battle form ends, your size shifts. Until removed, you gain the effects of enlarge, but are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.
2 When your battle form ends, one arm becomes stuck. Until removed, you maintain a single granted Strike from the battle form, but the arm is otherwise unable to be used for more than it could be while polymorphed.
3 When your battle form ends, one leg remains stuck. Until removed, you suffer a -10 ft penalty to Speed, but increase your Leap distance by 15 ft.
4 When your battle form ends, your head is partially stuck. Until removed, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}, but maintain the form's bite or jaws attack if it had one.
5 When your battle form ends, remnants of the form blend into your natural appearance all over. Until removed, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} but gain a +2 circumstance bonus to hostile Charisma actions.
6 When the battle form ends, your senses are partially stuck. Until removed, you are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} but retain any special senses the form had.
7 When the battle form ends, you are mostly stuck. The battle form lasts until removed, but you can speak clearly enough to communicate with your allies.
8 When you next see an enemy die, you become lost in battle. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} condition, and must pass its flat check twice to recover. These successes do not need to be subsequent.
9 When you transform, the mutagens are less potent than you thought. The GM rolls a secret d4, setting the battle form's duration to that many rounds. Roll a d6 on this table and combine its result with this one.
10 There is a dormant malfunction. Note the current battle form. The next time you would come under a morph or polymorph effect, roll a d8 on this table, applying the results as if you had just benefitted from the noted battle form.

Understanding the need for aggression, you have improved your footwork. Instead of only triggering on Actions with the fourish trait, your Flourish of Footwork is also compatible with Actions that have the attack trait.

Requirements You have at least 3 of the same contact poison within reach.

You have learned to saturate an area with poison in imitation of the techniques of your rival, Blue Viper. As part of this ability, you Interact to draw three vials of the same contact poison and throw them in the air, where they shatter and spread a poisonous deluge affecting a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 60 feet. All creatures in the burst are automatically exposed to the poison, immediately bypassing any onset time, and must attempt a saving throw against that poison. The three vials must be identical, even if the poison can come in multiple types or different levels.

Aerodynamic alterations to your creations, paired with much time among practice dummies, has enabled you to aggressively throw your lightweight items, using them at distances previously inconceivable. You peel at the bulk L item’s seal and hurl it toward a square or creature as it it were a bomb with a 10 ft base range increment.

A successful throw activates the item as if you had reach upon the square. This functions for bulk L items with 1 hand usage. This allows the remote use of comestibles such as elixirs on allies within distant squares.

Treat a willing target as if they were off-guard, and the maneuver functions on a miss or better. An empty square of basic terrain has an AC of 10, and the maneuver functions on a success or better.

A square occupied by a non-helpless unwilling target swats away the delicate throw, auto-failing the maneuver.

Any non-functional item throw misfires harmlessly, and any consumable involved becomes unsalvageable.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.5eKNb9NOGfqCg58T]{Symbiotic Lump}

+1 status penality to Fortitude saves.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.world.alchemistreformulated.Item.1ZtvoghddjQl2cjf]{Twirl Cordage}

If you take damage from an external source while a twirl is ongoing, make a single DC 5 @Check[type:flat|dc:5] check as you start your next turn. On fail, all twirls are disrupted, but the bombs may be used normally. If you start a turn with a twirling bomb, you gain a +2 status bonus to an attack made with the bomb.
